page.title: 04HEDGEROW AND WOODLAND
page.content: The flora consists mainly of hedgerow, woodland and a few aquatic species. Extensive sheep grazing and herbicides have destroyed plants over a large area. Among hedgerow plants are five species of vetch, three of ranunculus, marsh and common stachys, bryony, wild arum, dog_violets, milkmaids, bind_ weed honeysuckle, primroses, dog rose and field rose. The trees are mainly oak standards with hazel and chestnut coppice, ash, hornbeam, wild cherry and spindle. Few elms remain as Dutch Elm Disease killed many a few years ago. Woodland species include wood anemone, bluebell, St. John's wort,speedwell, stitchwort and fox_ glove. Aquatic species include water crowfoot, water cress, forget_me_ not, water plantain and reed mace. The hedges are mainly hawthorn, blackthorn and bramble.
